decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly lowering your own life total to enable powerful cards like Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf. Using cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, you can disrupt your opponent's game plan while also fueling your own. The deck also includes cards like Stubborn Denial and Tarfire to protect your threats and deal with opposing creatures. With the ability to search for specific cards with Traverse the Ulvenwald, this deck aims to be fast and aggressive, putting pressure on your opponent from the start.

This deck aims to fill the graveyard quickly and take advantage of the Dredge mechanic to recur creatures and gain value from discarding cards. It uses cards like Life from the Loam and Faithless Looting to stock the graveyard, while also including cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate to drain the opponent's life total. The main win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures like Prized Amalgam, Narcomoeba, and Bloodghast that keep coming back from the graveyard, making it difficult for the opponent to keep up.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, while also benefiting from cards like Life from the Loam to help recycle your lands. By milling cards from your own deck, you can trigger abilities like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba to bring creatures back onto the battlefield, creating a powerful and resilient board presence. The deck also includes cards like Conflagrate and Creeping Chill to provide additional reach and close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. The deck then aims to control the game through powerful creatures like Karn Liberated, Ugin the Spirit Dragon, and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes cards like Relic of Progenitus and Oblivion Stone to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The end game plan is to play massive threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and World Breaker to close out the game.

The main strategy of this deck is to flood the battlefield with Human creatures that have powerful synergy and disruptive abilities. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent quickly through aggressive creatures like Mantis Rider and Champion of the Parish. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Phantasmal Image can copy key creatures for added value. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed, synergy, and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quickly growing board of Human creatures while disrupting their plans with cards like Thalia, Meddling Mage, and Kitesail Freebooter. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch, the deck can quickly deploy threats and outmaneuver the opponent. The synergy between cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish allows for explosive turns and aggressive plays, while cards like Reflector Mage provide tempo advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the consistent casting of Human creatures.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Human creatures that benefit from each other's presence on the battlefield. By utilizing creatures like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck can quickly grow its board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful assault. Cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Reflector Mage disrupt the opponent's game plan while creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter allow for disruption of key cards in the opponent's hand. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play and maintain the deck's momentum.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Combo - Infect deck is to quickly and efficiently infect your opponent with poison counters using creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, supported by pump spells like Mutagenic Growth, Might of Old Krosa, and Groundswell. The deck also includes protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense to ensure your creatures can get through for lethal damage. Additionally, the mana base is optimized for consistency with fetch lands like Verdant Catacombs and Misty Rainforest to fetch the necessary dual lands and Inkmoth Nexus for an alternate win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and consistently fill your graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, allowing you to trigger powerful graveyard abilities such as Creeping Chill and Conflagrate. By utilizing cards like Stinkweed Imp and Narcomoeba, you can easily bring back cards like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast from your graveyard, creating a strong board presence. Additionally, cards like Life from the Loam allow you to continuously recycle key lands like Dakmor Salvage and Ghost Quarter, providing you with consistent mana and disruption options throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard synergies to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back for explosive plays. By repeatedly milling cards and discarding, the deck can cast spells directly from the graveyard, deal damage to the opponent, and swarm the board with creatures. The key strategy is to set up the graveyard as quickly as possible while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast-paced aggression and resilient creatures.

The main idea of this deck is to control and disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing land destruction spells like Stone Rain and Molten Rain, and shutting down nonbasic lands with Blood Moon. The deck also aims to ramp up mana quickly by using Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf, and then finish off the opponent with powerful threats like Inferno Titan, Chandra, Torch of Defiance, and Bloodbraid Elf. This deck focuses on locking down the opponent's resources and overwhelming them with big creatures and burn spells.

This deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with aggressive Human creatures, supported by disruptive elements like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to control the opponent's resources. The mana base is optimized for easy casting of multiple colored creatures, and Aether Vial provides additional versatility in deploying threats. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thalia's Lieutenant provide support to the aggro strategy by slowing down the opponent and buffing the team, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault.

The deck focuses on utilizing small, evasive infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, combined with pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa to quickly deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. Protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Spell Pierce help protect the combo, while Become Immense provides a finishing blow. The deck also includes card draw spells like Distortion Strike and can generate mana through Noble Hierarch and other lands. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through infect damage before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently utilize artifacts and sacrifice them to generate mana using Krark-Clan Ironworks. The deck focuses on recurring artifacts from the graveyard and generating card advantage with cards like Scrap Trawler and Ichor Wellspring. The deck also utilizes various ways to draw cards and generate colored mana to cast spells effectively. The end goal is to set up a loop of sacrificing and recurring artifacts to generate enough mana to win the game through a powerful combo or overwhelming board presence.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards in order to bring out powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix and Bedlam Reveler. The key strategy is to use cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Izzet Charm to control the board while building up spells in the graveyard to bring back the Phoenix and trigger Bedlam Reveler's ability. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and maintain card advantage through card draw and graveyard interactions.

The main idea of this UR Storm deck is to quickly generate mana through spells like Desperate Ritual and Manamorphose, while also reducing the cost of spells with Goblin Electromancer and Baral. The deck aims to dig through the deck using cantrips like Opt and Serum Visions to find combo pieces like Gifts Ungiven and Past in Flames. Once the combo pieces are assembled, the deck can chain together a large number of spells in a single turn to generate lethal amounts of storm count and finish the game with a Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens.
